answers.answer: It's somewhat contradictory, but Nortriptyline and beta-blockers such as Toprol XL have been shown to increase the risk of developing diabetes (low blood sugar) in hypertensive patients as well as increasing blood sugar. It's not common, but beta-blockers can occasionally increase blood sugars by inhibiting insulin secretion.

question: Hello, during another round of testing for possible other conditions to possibly rule out MS, they recently found my blood sugars to be high, but did not label it as diabetes. So I am wondering what could be causing that. Could it be my meds?
title: Can my meds elevated sugars
